(∂P/∂V)T = 0 and (∂²P/∂V²)T = 0 at T = Tc , P = Pc , V = Vc
One obtains the well-known algebraic relations Vc = 3 b, Pc = R Tc / (8 b), a = 27 R² Tc² / (64 Pc)
Hence the vdW constants expressed through the critical temperature Tc and critical pressure Pc are b = R Tc / (8 Pc), a = 27 R² Tc² / (64 Pc)
These formulas allow one to calculate the van der Waals parameters directly from experimentally measured critical data.
